result.execSummary:
The defendant Harold Norman Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Harold Norman Lewis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Harold Norman Lewis was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Cash bail on deposit to apply. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-No DNA surcharge as no sample was taken.
Due to this DV conviction, s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens;
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

Bail  Refund Packets

received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Harold Norman Lewis in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 3/25/16.
-Complete a CIGP program.   
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-No DNA surcharge as no sample was taken.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm
Witness fee request prepared for Cheryl A. J. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Witness fee request prepared for Cedric J. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Court ordered defendant's child removed from the no contact order.

Defendant Harold Norman Lewis in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
State withdrew the Amended Information.  
AS TO COUNTS 4, 6 AND 7:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed.  
.
AS TO COUNT 8:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.5  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Out of the presence of the jury, Court ruled on the admissabilty of the 911 calls as stated on the record.  Jury in the box at 9:59 am and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Cedric J. Exhibit #'s 1,2 received.  Jury out of the box.  Cedric J. questioned as to offer of proof.  Jury in the box and testimony continued.  Jury excused for lunch at 11:35 am.  Trial continued to 1:30 pm.
received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Harold Norman Lewis in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to dismiss is granted by the Court without prejudice.

For reasons stated on the record, Court denied defense Batson motion.  Jury trial continued to 10/27/15 at 9:00 am.
